page.title: 13RESCOBIE'S DISTRICT NURSE
page.content: Patients'{Attitudes}towards the District{Nurse}are mixed. Some took a while to get used to her as she is no longer part of the community because the nurse's house in Letham was sold. One{Problem}is patient acceptance. Some of them are difficult because they live alone and want independence. She sometimes worries about the job as it is easy to get involved. The Nurse enjoys her work but finds it very demanding as there is no-one to help her. She enjoys Midwifery but believes that she might move to Health Visiting eventually. It interferes with her social life but she doesn't think it is as bad as hospital duty. The District Nurse considers she is reasonably well paid since the nurses' big{Pay}rise in 1978 but she doesn't mind about money, she would never change jobs.
